column1: Host Offense: Validation of FGI-103 as a Broad Spectrum Therapeutic Modality for Targeting Viral Infections
column3: ...to an undisclosed host factor, was developed and used to generate a series of antiviral compound analogs. One FGI-103 compound conferred 100% protection to mice infected with Ebola or Marburg viruses, at a dose of 5 mg/kg. Furthermore, the single dose administered 48 h post exposure significantly increased survival in Ebola infected animals. Due to the use of common host mechanisms by unrelated virus families, such therapeutics may have potential as broad-spectrum antivirals.
